definitions: confident declaration or statement of belief presented as true without proof or evidence
examples: Her assertion that she witnessed the incident was later confirmed
The scientist made several bold assertions about climate change

definitions: person who evaluates property value for taxation or examines performance and skills
examples: The tax assessor determined the property's value at half a million
An independent assessor reviewed all the exam papers for fairness

definitions: process of adapting to and adopting characteristics of a different culture or group
absorption and digestion of nutrients or information into an organism or system
examples: The immigrant family's assimilation took several years to complete
Language assimilation often happens naturally through daily interactions
The body's assimilation of vitamins requires proper digestive function
Complete assimilation of the new data will take considerable time

definitions: collection of different types of things grouped together
examples: The shop offered an impressive assortment of handmade chocolates
She picked through the assortment of buttons to find matches

definitions: positive declaration intended to give confidence or remove doubt
type of insurance policy that pays out after a specific event
examples: He gave his assurance that the project would finish on time
Despite her assurances, we remained skeptical about the plan
She purchased life assurance to protect her family's future
The assurance policy matures when the holder reaches age sixty-five

definitions: typographical symbol (*) used to mark footnotes or indicate omissions
examples: Place an asterisk next to any items requiring special attention
The asterisk in the contract led to important terms and conditions

definitions: small rocky body orbiting the sun, mainly found between Mars and Jupiter
examples: Scientists tracked the asteroid as it passed near Earth's orbit
The asteroid belt contains millions of these rocky objects

definitions: chronic respiratory disease causing difficulty breathing due to inflamed airways
examples: Her asthma worsened during the spring pollen season
The child carries an inhaler to manage sudden asthma attacks

definitions: individual who suffers from the chronic respiratory condition of asthma
examples: The asthmatic struggled to climb the steep stairs without pausing
Many asthmatics find relief through proper medication and lifestyle changes

definitions: feeling of great surprise or amazement that overwhelms one's expectations
examples: To everyone's astonishment, the underdog team won the championship
She stared in astonishment at the unexpected birthday party

definitions: substance that causes contraction of body tissues, typically used to cleanse skin
examples: The facial astringent helped reduce the appearance of large pores
Witch hazel serves as a natural astringent for oily skin

definitions: person who studies celestial bodies to predict human affairs and earthly events
examples: The astrologer created detailed birth charts for her clients
Many newspapers employ an astrologer to write daily horoscope columns

definitions: study of celestial bodies' movements and positions to predict earthly and human affairs
examples: She consulted astrology before making any major life decisions
Western astrology divides the year into twelve zodiac signs

definitions: person trained to travel and work in spacecraft beyond Earth's atmosphere
examples: The astronaut spent six months aboard the International Space Station
Becoming an astronaut requires years of rigorous training and preparation

definitions: scientific study of celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole
examples: She studied astronomy to understand the mysteries of distant galaxies
Modern astronomy relies heavily on advanced telescopes and computer modeling

definitions: scientist who studies the physical properties and processes of celestial objects and phenomena
examples: The astrophysicist published groundbreaking research on black hole behavior
Many astrophysicists work at observatories analyzing data from space telescopes

definitions: protection granted by a nation to refugees fleeing persecution
historical term for institution housing people with mental illness
examples: The family sought political asylum after fleeing their war-torn country
Several countries offered asylum to the persecuted journalists
The old asylum has been converted into a museum of medical history
Victorian asylums were often places of confinement rather than treatment

definitions: absence of balance or equality between corresponding parts or aspects of something
examples: The artist deliberately created asymmetry in the sculpture's design
Facial asymmetry is completely normal and adds character to appearance

definitions: workshop or studio used by an artist or designer
examples: The fashion designer's atelier buzzed with activity before the show
She rented an atelier in the arts district to create her paintings

definitions: absence of belief in the existence of gods or divine beings
examples: His atheism developed gradually through years of philosophical study
The debate between atheism and theism has persisted throughout history

definitions: person who does not believe in the existence of any gods or divine beings
examples: The atheist participated respectfully in the philosophical debate about religion
Many famous scientists throughout history have identified as atheists

definitions: physical qualities characteristic of athletes including strength, fitness, and agility
examples: Her natural athleticism made her excel at multiple sports
The dance performance required extraordinary athleticism and grace

definitions: automated teller machine that dispenses cash and performs basic banking transactions
examples: She withdrew money from the ATM before heading to the market
The nearest ATM is located inside the grocery store entrance

definitions: ring-shaped coral reef or island encircling a lagoon
examples: The tropical atoll provided a perfect habitat for diverse marine life
Many atolls in the Pacific face threats from rising sea levels

definitions: smallest unit of ordinary matter that retains properties of an element
examples: Every atom contains protons, neutrons, and electrons in specific arrangements
Scientists split the atom in groundbreaking twentieth-century physics experiments

definitions: action of making amends for wrongdoing or sin through reparation or penance
examples: He sought atonement for his past mistakes through community service
The ritual of atonement plays a central role in many religions

definitions: large open space within a building, often with a glass roof
upper chamber of the heart that receives blood
examples: The hotel's atrium featured a stunning indoor garden and fountain
Natural light flooded through the glass ceiling of the atrium
Blood flows from the right atrium into the right ventricle
The left atrium receives oxygenated blood from the lungs

definitions: extremely wicked or cruel act, typically involving physical violence or injury
examples: The war crimes tribunal investigated atrocities committed against civilians
News of the atrocity shocked the international community into action

definitions: gradual decline in effectiveness or vigor due to underuse or neglect
examples: Muscle atrophy occurred after months of immobilization in a cast
Without practice, his language skills began to atrophy

definitions: person assigned to diplomatic staff with expertise in specific areas
examples: The cultural attache organized art exhibitions between the two countries
A military attache advises the ambassador on defense matters

definitions: emotional bond between people, especially in close relationships
object or device added to something else to enhance function
examples: The child formed a strong attachment to her kindergarten teacher
Secure attachment in infancy promotes healthy emotional development
The vacuum cleaner came with several attachments for different surfaces
She opened the email attachment to review the document

definitions: individual who uses violence or aggression against another person or thing
examples: The attacker fled the scene before police could arrive
Witnesses helped identify the attacker from security camera footage

definitions: action or fact of achieving a goal, especially after effort
examples: Educational attainment strongly correlates with lifetime earning potential
The attainment of her doctorate represented years of dedication

definitions: person employed to provide service or assistance in specific settings
examples: The flight attendant demonstrated the safety procedures before takeoff
A parking attendant directed cars to available spaces

definitions: person who attends or is present at an event or gathering
examples: Conference attendees received name badges and information packets
The wedding had over two hundred attendees from around the world

definitions: senior physician who supervises residents and medical students in hospitals
examples: The attending physician reviewed all the residents' treatment plans
She consulted with the attending before prescribing the new medication

definitions: formal confirmation or authentication of something as true or genuine
examples: The document required attestation by a licensed notary public
Her attestation of the events proved crucial to the investigation

definitions: space or room directly under the roof of a house
examples: They stored old furniture and holiday decorations in the attic
The attic conversion created an extra bedroom for the growing family

definitions: clothes or garments, especially of a specified formal or distinctive type
examples: Business attire is required for all employees during work hours
The wedding invitation specified formal attire for the evening ceremony

definitions: action of ascribing a work, remark, or quality to a particular source
examples: Proper attribution of sources prevents plagiarism in academic writing
The painting's attribution to Rembrandt was later proven false

definitions: process of gradually reducing strength or effectiveness through sustained pressure or harassment
examples: Employee attrition reached concerning levels during the restructuring period
The long war became a battle of attrition between opposing forces

definitions: public sale where goods or property are sold to the highest bidder
examples: The rare painting sold for millions at the charity auction
Online auctions have revolutionized how people buy collectibles

definitions: person who conducts auctions by accepting bids and declaring goods sold
examples: The auctioneer's rapid speech captivated bidders throughout the sale
An experienced auctioneer can significantly increase final sale prices

definitions: willingness to take bold risks or show disrespectful boldness
examples: She had the audacity to challenge the CEO's decision publicly
His audacity in attempting the dangerous stunt impressed everyone
